title: Play-Based Science Learning Design in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science theories and experimental methodologies
context.additional_context: Practical science competency enhancement program for in-house scientists/researchers, featuring a flexible learning environment utilizing personal devices

learning_goals: Explain complex scientific concepts with ≥85% accuracy through play-based learning activities
Successfully replicate real-world scientific problem-solving processes ≥3 times using role-play simulations
Independently create interactive learning materials using digital tools (apps/software)

Learners write a structured 1,500-character report (introduction-body-conclusion format) on playful learning experiences based on monthly peer evaluations (2 times) and self-reflection (1 time), achieving an "excellent" grade in at least two of the three evaluation rubric criteria (clarity, systematicity, depth of reflection) upon submission.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
